intro: Viborquia polystachya, commonly known as the hairy leaf vine, is a climbing plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. Viborquia polystachya is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
